title: [Large-Scale] Internet-Based Behavioral Intervention Design Considering Cultural Context

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational psychology theories, basic concepts of behavior intervention techniques, and experience utilizing digital platforms
context.additional_context: Strengthening competencies in designing behavior intervention techniques that reflect cultural diversity within smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze cultural factors to derive behavior intervention requirements for the target population.
Learners can apply a culturally contextualized design framework when designing internet-based behavior intervention technologies.
Learners can produce and evaluate behavior intervention content optimized for smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
